Class ContextGenerate

java.lang.Object
org.knowledge.finder.generate.ContextGenerate
public class ContextGenerate extends Object
The ContextGenerate class is responsible for generating a structured project directory containing lesson-based markdown files from an input text file.

It reads content from an input file, processes headings and lessons, and creates:

  • A main context.md file with structured links to lessons.
  • Subdirectories for each lesson section.
  • Individual markdown files for each subsection of a lesson.

This class uses LessonsData to manage lessons and section headings, and handles all I/O operations required for file and directory creation.

  • Constructor Details

    • ContextGenerate

      public ContextGenerate(String inputFileName, String outputFileName, String projectNameWithDash, LessonsData lessonsData, String lessonFolderName, String contextLinkPage)
      Constructs a ContextGenerate instance with the required configuration.
      Parameters:
      inputFileName - the input file containing raw lesson content
      outputFileName - the output file name for processed content
      projectNameWithDash - the project name, also used as directory name
      lessonsData - the LessonsData object storing processed lessons
      lessonFolderName - the base name for lesson subdirectories
      contextLinkPage - the common link or footer text appended in each markdown file

  • Method Details

    • getInputFileName

      Returns:
      the input file name

      public void setInputFileName(String inputFileName)

      Parameters:
      inputFileName - the input file name to set

      public String getOutputFileName()

    • isSectionHeading

      public boolean isSectionHeading(String line)
      Checks whether a given line represents a section heading.
      Parameters:
      line - a line from the input file
      Returns:
      true if the line starts with "# ", otherwise false

    • process

      public void process()
      Main processing method that orchestrates the workflow:
      1. Creates the project directory.
      2. Reads and parses the input file.
      3. Populates LessonsData with headings and lessons.
      4. Generates context.md with links to lesson subsections.
      5. Creates subfolders and markdown files for each lesson subsection.

    • createDir

      public void createDir()
      Creates the project root directory using the project name. If the directory already exists, it will not be recreated.

    • handleHeading

      public void handleHeading(BufferedWriter writer, Integer sectionNumber) throws IOException
      Handles writing a section heading to the context file and stores its folder name.
      Parameters:
      writer - the BufferedWriter for writing to the context file
      sectionNumber - the current section number
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • handleLesson

      public void handleLesson(BufferedWriter writer, Integer sectionNumber) throws IOException
      Handles writing lesson subsections as links into the context file.
      Parameters:
      writer - the BufferedWriter for writing to the context file
      sectionNumber - the current section number
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • createSubfoldersAndMarkdownFiles

      public void createSubfoldersAndMarkdownFiles()
      Creates subfolders for each lesson section and generates individual markdown files for all subsections.

      Each markdown file contains a title and a link reference defined by contextLinkPage.
